divs: sighting detailsi was sitting in my yard, just watching the sky, which i do as we live not far from three airports and i like to watch the planes. at approximately 1545 hours, i was looking towards the southeast and saw an object traveling in a roughly northerly direction. it was either very high in altitude or at a great distance, as i could not make out any shape. it looked like i was seeing a star during daylight, or more like a planet, as it was larger than a star. i kept watching it as i felt it was a plane and figured that as it got closer, i would make out some detail on it. it continued on its path, which was a straight line. it went behind a tree, then reappeared on the same course. i then started wondering if it could have been a mylar balloon but dismissed that because it had traveled in such a straight line. additionally, light cirrus clouds were traveling in basically the opposite direction from the object. after the object reappeared from behind the tree is when i started thinking something was strange, as it then stopped moving for about thirty seconds then changed course approximately 90 degrees to its right. it moved in that direction, now more or less in an easterly direction for a few more seconds, then completely stopped. i watched it as it stayed in place\hovered for a good two minutes, then it continued in an easterly direction until it was obscured by high, hazy clouds, at which point i could no longer see it. i seriously doubt it was a balloon because of the fact that it stopped dead and also that it was traveling in such a straight line. but when it made the 90 degree course change, i knew something was strange about it. i mentioned living near airports. that would be jfk, laguardia and westchester county in white plains, new york. we're not "near" them but on approach and departure lanes so i see a lot of planes during the day which is why i like to sit and watch them especially on a nice clear day as this has been. and i do not think what i saw was a helicopter as it appeared to be much too high. finally, from what i could tell, it was not producing any light of its own, but reflecting sunlight which was very bright at the time.
